alert.note: Alert for East Baton Rouge; Livingston (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued January 24 at 8:21PM CST until January 24 at 9:00PM CST by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 830 PM CST FOR WESTERN ST. HELENA...NORTHWESTERN LIVINGSTON...EAST FELICIANA AND NORTHEASTERN EAST BATON ROUGE PARISHES... At 819 PM CST, a severe thunderstorm was located near Garden City, or 17 miles northwest of Liberty, moving northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Zachary, Baker, Clinton, Slaughter, Wilson, Norwood, Pride, Felps and Darlington. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 100 AM CST for southeastern Louisiana. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. This storm has a history of producing heavy wind damage. SEEK SHELTER NOW inside a sturdy structure and stay away from windows.
